P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?

Resolution Criteria

not_P.title: Will Europa not be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa before January 1, 2045, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Could Europa be the initial location where humanity encounters alien life, assuming it is found prior to 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if humanity uncovers credible proof of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before discovering extraterrestrial life in any other part of the universe. Should convincing evidence of alien life be found elsewhere before that time, this question will be answered negatively. If no extraterrestrial life is discovered before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently alive and (b) highly improbable to have resulted from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life being transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered methods.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (2) An exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (b) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, the question about Europa will be Annulled.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, or (2) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, the first condition will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, the first condition will be Annulled. If neither condition is met, this question will resolve as No.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, and (b) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if: (1) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030, and (2) humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as Yes. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?

If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given the discovery of extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe; (2) an exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (b) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 and (b) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life anywhere other than Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life on Europa. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa prior to anywhere else, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life anywhere other than Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life on Europa. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) Life is discovered on Mars by the year 2050 and (b) Europa is not the initial location where humanity finds extraterrestrial life, assuming it is found prior to 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if both of the following conditions are satisfied:
(a) Notable and highly esteemed scientific institutions declare that unequivocal evidence of either current or past life on Mars has been found, independent of life transported from Earth to Mars through human-engineered missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Humanity uncovers credible evidence of life elsewhere, not including Europa, before January 1, 2045, and does so prior to discovering extraterrestrial life on Europa. Should extraterrestrial life be convincingly identified on Europa before any other location, this question will be answered with No. If no extraterrestrial life is discovered before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) extremely unlikely to originate from Earth-based contamination. This allows for the possibility of life that has been carried from Earth by means other than human-engineered methods.
If either of these conditions is unmet, this question will resolve as No.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030 and (2) Neither of the following occurs: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 nor (b) Europa is the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?

P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

P.body:

This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. not_P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes not fall below 75 years before 2040?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is 75 years or more, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the average life expectancy at birth in the US for both genders to dip below 75 years prior to the year 2040?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if, at any point between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2040, the average life expectancy at birth (for both genders) in the US falls beneath 75 years, as reported by the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the question.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040, and (b) there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this part of the question. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, with data for resolution coming from NASA, if possible.

P.title: Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120 (2) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if (1) there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading AND (2) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
Fine Print
For (1), we'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia: The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place. For (2), data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible, with the critical value to look for being 1.8 ˚C based on the 1951-1980 baseline.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The USA enters a second civil war before 2031 (b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The USA enters a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
(b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is never a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The USA experiences a second civil war prior to 2031 (b) There will not be a complete year without any active stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied:
(a) The USA undergoes a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be established if all of the following conditions are fulfilled prior to January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is enacted.
- While the Insurrection Act is in effect, there are at least 500 fatalities within a 6 month timeframe due to armed confrontations between US citizens and a segment of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts involving those branches.
- All fatalities occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any engagements between the US military and the armed forces of another nation will not be taken into account for this question. Engagements between the US military and US citizens, potentially aided by foreign nations with weaponry or resources, will be included. Conflicts involving civilians and local law enforcement will not be considered, unless there are active military forces in the vicinity providing mutual assistance. Fatalities will be tallied across all states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. Newly admitted states will be included, while states that secede or are removed will not be counted. Suicides will not be included in the death toll.
(b) There will never be an entire year without any stock exchanges operating in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is not a stretch of at least 12 consecutive months before the conclusion of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges available for trading. We will refer to the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market pertains to the aggregate of markets and exchanges where regular transactions of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies occur.

Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China will lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050 (b) At least one of the following will not occur: (i) The USA enters a second civil war before 2031 (ii) There is at least one full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. The armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before January 1, 2050. This will be determined if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
   - There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   - There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   - These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
2. At least one of the following conditions is met:
   (i) The USA does not enter a second civil war before January 1, 2031, determined by:
   - The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
   - While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
   - Not all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
   (ii) There is at least one full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, determined by:
   - A period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
This question will resolve as No otherwise.

The deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or year; multiple events can contribute to the total. This question resolves as No otherwise.

P_and_Q.body:
(1) Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120? (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria for (a): This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. Fine Print: We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): the stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place. 
Resolution Criteria for (b): This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031: The Insurrection Act is invoked; while the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches; all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC). Conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count. 
(2) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Resolution Criteria: This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031, or (c) a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

(c) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, and (b) neither a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120 nor the USA entering a second civil war before 2031?
Q_and_not_P.body:
(a) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

(b) Will neither of the following occur: (1) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, nor (2) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
(1) Will there be no full year with open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
This question will resolve positively if there is not a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.

(2) Will the USA not enter a second civil war before 2031?
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are not met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
Not all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
